trans-unit.source: Respect crop editor choices in sys_file_reference table?
Whether to respect or ignore the selected cropping of the image from the sys_file_reference table.
Display or hide the crop editor in sys_file_reference.
Which table holds the focus area data?

With metadata the sys_file_metadata table is used and only ONE focus area can be defined per image. With the sys_file_reference table any reference can have a different focus area defined per image, but it also NEEDS to be defined per reference again.
Allow special preview mode which shows previews based on ALL defined media queries.
An additional step is introduced before/during resizing of an image to ensure the image uses the correct colorspace (based on $GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['GFX']['colorspace'])
Erlaube Transparenz in Ergebnisbildern? (Ja/Nein/Nur in Portraits)

This setting is used to allow transparency in the final images. When transparency is allowed the focus and crop areas are strictly followed, otherwise the images are always the desired resolution but crop and focus areas can be partially or completely ignored!
